news.title: Broadly Neutralizing Antibodies Show Strong Potential for HIV Treatment
news.summary: According to a recent article, broadly neutralizing antibodies (bNAbs) show promise in defeating the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1).

news.title: Neutralizing Antibody Modestly Effective in Patients With HIV
news.summary: VRC01, an antibody that targets the HIV CD4 binding site, modestly delays viral rebound in patients with HIV who have discontinued antiretroviral therapy (ART), but does not maintain viral suppression through 8 weeks, according to results from two…

news.title: HIV Antibody VRC01 Shows Promise in Early Trials
news.summary: THURSDAY, Nov. 10, 2016 (HealthDay News) -- Antibodies may keep the HIV virus in check and one day allow patients to stop taking antiretroviral drugs, according to research published online Nov.

facebook.summary: High serum titers of neutralizing antibodies develop in a small fraction of people who become infected with HIV-1. Isolation of such broadly neutralizing antibodies (bNAbs) has led to a new and promising approach to combat HIV-1 infection.  http://nej.md/2
